title: Ban on sale of lighters in MTR stations from March 1, following Hong Kong firebomb attack | South China Morning Post
text:
Ban on sale of lighters in MTR stations from March 1, following Hong Kong firebomb attack 
Company notified convenience stores involved that they must stop selling lighters to ensure safety in stations PUBLISHED : Wednesday, 22 February, 2017, 2:05pm UPDATED : Wednesday, 22 February, 2017, 2:05pm MTR Corporation sets up panel to probe firebomb attack 13 Feb 2017 
The MTR Corporation is banning the sale of lighters in convenience stores at its stations following the arson attack on a train earlier this month. 
A spokesman said the convenience stores concerned had been notified that they should not sell lighters from March 1 to ensure public safety in stations. 
The cityâ€™s sole mass transit railways operator said the notification was issued after a recent assessment. 
Man charged with arson after Hong Kong MTR attack leaves 19 commuters injured 
Some Facebook users criticised the new move, saying an arsonist could still buy a lighter elsewhere. 
Others called it a palliative measure, and some said mockingly that MTR should simply bar all passengers from entering stations to avoid another fire. 
A 60-year-old man has been charged with arson following a firebomb attack on a packed train travelling from Admiralty to Tsim Sha Tsui during the evening rush hour on February 10. The suspect was believed to have started the blaze with a lighter, leaving 19 injured.
